definitions: the complete removal or destruction of something

examples.text: the elimination of extreme poverty is a key objective
a global commitment to the elimination of nuclear weapons

definitions: the exclusion of someone or something from consideration or further participation

examples.text: a 1-1 draw confirmed their elimination from the tournament
after the initial elimination rounds, 16 boys qualified for the final

shortDefinitions: exclusion of person or thing from consideration or further participation

definitions: the expulsion of waste matter from the body

examples.text: the treatment promotes the elimination of toxins

shortDefinitions: expulsion of waste matter from body

definitions: the removal of a variable from an equation, typically by substituting another which is shown by another equation to be equivalent
shortDefinitions: removal of variable from equation equation

definitions: the generation of a simple substance as a product in the course of a reaction involving larger molecules

examples.text: a condensation reaction can link together two monosaccharide sugars to form a disaccharide with the elimination of water

shortDefinitions: generation of simple substance as product in course of reaction
